It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, intricate fronds with a distinctive, finely divided structure. Its spore-producing structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds, a common feature in many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Elaphoglossum cherapunjii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
